name: My Portfolio
discription: Desgined with the goal of being my primary showcase of skill and experience, my Portfolio also reflects myself and my style.
sourceCode: My portfolio has changed a lot over the years. It has become my playground to practice my skills and experiment with new components. New design principles and design heuristics have dramatically changed the UI and UX experience of the site. I have made my portfolio accessible to everyone by designing with all kinds of users in mind. My portfolio will also be transitioning into an angular project. Some problems with this transition are: legacy code needs replacement and a shift from Materialize to Bootstrap.

name: BULLET SHIPPING Game
imgAlt: Main Title Page of Bullet Shipping
discription: First time designing a game from scratch. Our team used Unity and C# to create a 2D Bullet Hell Platformer that follows the Game design prinicples covered in the course.
sourceCode:
Informatics 125 Project

Bullet Shipping was created as our teams final project in Informatics 125 Game development. The game is created on the Unity Game Engine and is programmed in C#. This project allowed me to explore a new language and learn about game history and development. Our team of 5 created a Functional game with 1 level, an elaborate Game Design Document, and a website for game adverticement. This project required sprites, scripts, and assets to be custom made specifically for our game, allowing me to get a diverse set of experiences.

https://bullet-shipping.weebly.com

name: Mgr. Peter
discription: Mgr. Peter is the result of a quarter long project for Informatics 134.
sourceCode:
Informatics 134 Project

Mrg. Peter is a College Life Management App that students can use to keep track of and accomplish tasks while enrolled at UC Irvine. These tasks can include keeping track of meals, placing shopping orders, viewing parking statistics, buying parking permits, and/or ordering supplies. The layout and feel of this prototype are very traditional. That was by design to stay consistent with the standards and the subsequent UCI systems already in place.

Interactive Prototype

Speculative Story

I plan on extending our product into a wearable device such as a watch. A watch would be a good choice because it has a screen that is conveniently located on the wrist and can display widgets from the phone app home screen. The user can stroll through widgets until they find the one they are looking for. The widgets will either display Shopping, Parking, Meals, or Account information. Some widgets can perform actions based on preset defaults selected by the user. The user will need to be able to control the watch app using their pre installed and set up Mgr.Peter app on their phone. From there the user can also select presets that will help with widgets down the line. Some presets include Preferred payment method, Shipping address, Amount of time for parking extension, Amount of meals swipes to add, and the Favorite Widget.

name: UCI Content Management System
discription: UC, Irvine: Content Management System is the result of a quarter long project for Informatics 151.

name: Music Notation
imgAlt: Screen shot of iPad app Music Notation
discription: An iPad application designed to allow music creators new way to display / compose music and share it with musicians for live concerts
sourceCode:
Informatics 117 Project

For this project, our team goal was to create a Music Notation App that would satisfy the requirements placed by our sponsor. This project was special to me because it was the first time I was part of an Agile Scrum team and experienced weekly meetings with my team and sponsor to discuss our weekly progress. Overall this project helped me get a sense of what the workplace would be like and how it is important to keep the customer involved throughout the process. The design for this project is very modern and minimalistic. Thanks to feedback from the sponsor, we were able to make this prototype feel revolutionary and modern like the music it is creating. This project also tackled complex interaction and allowed me to put to use my skills as a UI/UX designer. One such interaction is the stream page in which a user needs to be able to quickly create a piece of music and quickly share it with the corresponding musicians.

Interactive Prototype

sourceCode:
Group Members: Saul Fernandez, Areeta Wong, Eric Chambers, Kingsley Szeto, Michelle Yi-Ting Huynh
Project for: Informatics 117 Spring 2021

name: Laundry Time
imgAlt: Screen Shot of App Laundry Time Prototype
sourceCode:
Informatics 131 Project

For this project, my goal was to address the problem of laundry being a heavy workload for people and work towards solving the problem. I had to conduct interviews and collect user data through Contextual Inquiry. The data I collected was then compiled into an application with features that would address the concerns and problems faced by students living in dormitories. With all my collected information I then began sketching ideas and then I began prototyping. After evaluations and changes, the Figma prototype to the right is the final version of the project.

name: CommuniLink
discription: This website was created for The SouthLA Hackaton 2016. Its function is to be a social forum of events occurring in the County of LA. This website uses information from an LA County API for event information.

name: WiFound
discription: This website was created for The SouthLA Hackaton 2015. Its function is to crowdsource locations to create a map of publicly available wifi networks around the area of Watts.

name: When Does Class End
discription: This web app was designed to inform students of my old high school when each class period would end. The app also features the schedules for holidays and short days.
